conclusion: The task is to predict which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
The baffles are rectangular shapes with arrows indicating the direction of flow. They are located at points A, B, C, D, E, and F.
The liquid is shown flowing out from points A, B, C, and D.
The flow is directed towards the baffles at points E and F.

Since the liquid is flowing out from points A, B, C, and D and is directed towards the baffles at points E and F, it follows that the liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container E.
